intro: Strigosella longipetala, commonly known as the long-petaled stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, often aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a strong, sometimes unpleasant odor. Strigosella longipetala is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
